name: Gluten-Free Tuesday: Brownies
description: Brownies, like most baked goods, seem to inspire lively debate. Cakey or fudgy? Iced or plain? With nuts or without? My feelings? As long as it's a brownie, please pass it to me! I love them all.* I even love the pale cousin of the brownie, the blondie. But today I want to talk about fudgy brownies.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup cocoa powder (either Dutch-process or natural)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly spray a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with gluten-free cooking spray.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together dry ingredients. Set aside.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar. (Use
medium-high speed with a handheld mixer or medium speed with a stand
mixer.)

Reduce mixer speed to medium. Add dry ingredients and vanilla
extract. Mix until a batter forms.
Remove pan from the oven and place on a wire rack to cool. When cool, cut into squares.
